intro: Dibrachion riparium, commonly known as the river water-plantain, is a flowering plant belonging to the Alismataceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in clustered inflorescences. It thrives in shallow, freshwater habitats such as rivers, streams, and ponds. Dibrachion riparium is typically found in temperate regions and plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
